sen.j: 羊羹色：黒色などの衣類が、色あせて赤みを帯びた色を「羊羹色」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: yokan color: when blackish clothes fade and get tinged with red, the color is called 'yokan color.'

sen.j: 夜の梅：虎屋黒川（通称とらや (東京都港区赤坂)、本店・赤坂）の代表的商品「小倉羊羹 夜の梅（登録商標）」がいちばん有名である。
sen.e: Yoru no ume (night plum): the most famous yokan under this name is 'Ogura-yokan Yoru no ume (registered trademark)', a representative product of Toraya Kurokawa (commonly known as Toraya (Akasaka, Minato Ward, Tokyo), the main store located in Akasaka).

sen.j: 切り口に見える小豆の粒の様子を、夜の闇の中に咲く白い梅の花に例えて付けられた名称。
sen.e: It is named by comparing the adzuki beans at the cut end to white plum blossoms in the shadows of night.

sen.j: とらやのものは、一般的な小倉羊羹よりも小豆の粒の量が少なめで粒のかたさもやわらかいのが特徴の煉羊羹。
sen.e: Ogura-yokan of Toraya is the neri-yokan which are characterized by the amount and hardness of adzuki beans: they are made of a little less beans than ordinary ones, and the beans are soft.

sen.e: It's like a cross between gem and pagodite: a phrase written in Soseki NATSUME's "Kusamakura" (novel) to express the beauty of yokan.
